fields.description:
Repro:
* With Split View Staging enabled, and some modified files, go to the File Status view
* Select a file in the Unstaged Files section (click on the filename, not the checkbox)
* Press Space
* => (x) The file will be added to the Staged Files, but the focus will be lost from the Unstaged Files section. In previous versions it was possible to press space several times to add files to the Stage.

Maybe related: Sometimes even when in the middle of typing in the Commit Message field, the focus will be lost, and one cannot continue typing.
I guess SourceTree looses focus every time it refreshes.
fields.summary: New in 2.2: Staging a File looses Focus

fields.description: Please, return Git-Flow button on the ToolBar. Or give the opportunity to add this button on Customize toolbar menu.
fields.summary: Return Git-Flow button on ToolBar

fields.description:
1. Open window at this way SourceTree > Preferences... > Custom Actions > Add
2. Select Ok and Cancel button
Nothing happening
fields.summary: Cancel or Ok button doesn't work on Add Custom Action window

fields.description: In the workspace search. Like to have the ability to apply multiple search criteria with logic operators.
fields.summary: Ability to apply multiple search criteria with logic operators.

fields.description:
Steps to repeat:

With a repository open,

1. Click "Settings",
2. Under "Remotes" click "Add",
3. Click "Hosted Projects" next to URL
4. Click "Edit Accounts..." button
5. Click "Add Account..." button
6. Selected "GitHub" from the dropdown menu
7. Enter username
8. Click "Set Password"
9. Enter password
10. Click "Login"
*11. Can no longer interact with SourceTree at all.*
fields.summary: SourceTree is unresponsive when creating a new remote account

fields.description:

4. Click "Edit Accounts..." button
5. Click "Add Account..." button
*6. "Cancel" button does not do anything.*

3. Click "Hosted Projects" next to URL

*5. "Close" button does not do anything.*
fields.summary: "close" button under "Edit Accounts" does nothing

fields.description:
Setup a submission template:
> echo "---SUBMISSION---" > ~/.commit_template.txt

add it to .gitconfig:
[commit]
   template = ~/.commit_template.txt

------
0) Commit
1) Default Commit template present in the text area
2) Choose "Amend Last Commit"
3) Dialog ask if previous commit text should be used. (Answer YES)
4) Previous commit text is not replacing the exiting text already present in the text area

NOTE: 
1) If there is no text in the text area, this works as expected.
2) This is not in any previous version before the UI change.
fields.summary: Amend does not clear the existing submission template even after say YES

fields.description:
Steps to repeat:

1. Click "Settings"
2. Under "remotes" click "Add"
3. Click "Hosted Projects" button next to URL
4. Click "Create New Remote..." button
5. "Cancel" button does not do anything.
fields.summary: "Cancel" button on the create remote dialog does nothing.
Missing icons for git checkout sheet

fields.description:
There is no good reason I should be forced to login with an Atlassian account to use SourceTree.

This ticket is a three-part request:

* Please add a "skip" button if I don't want to sign in
* Please add a warning in giant red text in the Software Update screen that installing the upgrade will break your workflow unless you register for an Atlassian account
* Please think more carefully about introducing breaking changes in the future
fields.summary: Mandatory Atlassian Signin is Really Annoying

fields.description:
Version 2.2.0 has the checkout button removed from the main toolbar, which is quite mad as it's one of the most used feature, the only way to do it is via menu, which is everything but user friendly.
The guy who proposed to remove it from there probably never used git in his life.
fields.summary: Checkout button is gone

fields.description:
After updating to version 2.2 (46), Sourcetree is constantly popping up an alert asking if it can use the git credentials from my keychain for github.com. Nothing happens when I press both the "Always Allow" button and the "Allow" button, but the "Deny" button still works. After I press "Deny", the popup comes up again and I press "Deny" again and it leaves for good. Then the action I was trying to do (fetching for example) completes successfully.

Other details:
* Terminal still works without asking to use my credentials
* My repos from bitbucket.com are still working
* Github.com is not having problems as far as I can tell
* I already tried restarting my computer
* This popup comes up even when I don't perform an action (probably from the automatic background repo check?)

Update: I fixed this myself by deleting the keys for "github.com" from the keychain.
fields.summary: After updating to version 2.2 (46), the "allow" button for git credentials from the keychain is broken

fields.description: After updating to 2.2 (46) today, the
fields.summary: After updating to version 2.2 (46), the "allow" button for git credentials from the keychain is broken

fields.description: With a Git repository, when you stash your changes and check the box that says "Keep staged changes", the local changes are discarded, even though the checkbox should prevent that. This worked in previous versions of SourceTree.
fields.summary: Stash with 'keep staged changes' doesn't keep staged changes

fields.description: It would be nice if we could delete multiple local branches/stashes at once.
fields.summary: Allow to select and delete multiple local branches/stashes

fields.description: It would be nice feature to allow users to delete local branches using {{backspace}} or {{cmd+backspace}}
fields.summary: Enable Backspace / CMD+Backspace to delete local branches

fields.description: After updating to 2.2 (46), the UI jumps around to the latest commit on different branches while in the middle of something. I have had this happen repeatedly this morning, ranging from me just reading code in a commit to see what changed (with hands off the keyboard and mouse), to in the middle of leaving a commit message. Every time, the UI jumps context and shows information pertaining to the latest commit on whatever branch it decides to show.
fields.summary: UI jumps around to different commits

fields.description:
Love the new UI look for version 2.2 Mac (Build 46). But in this redesign, you removed the Gitflow button from the toolbar. To make matters worse, you removed the toolbar to even house a Gitflow button if the user customizes it.

C'mon guys. Gitflow is an essential workflow to most Git users. How can you take a button that kicks off a process that is used dozens of times a day by millions of developers, and relegate that to a submenu?  

Please do us all a favor and restore the Gitflow button back to the toolbar. Please. With sugar on top. 

Thank you.
fields.summary: Latest update removes Gitflow button from toolbar

fields.description: Interactive rebase appears to be completely broken in 2.2. App gets stuck preparing the rebase (please see attached photo)
fields.summary: Interactive Rebase Broken
SourceTree is blocked when branches are merged

fields.description:
I updated today's version of source tree and I'm greeted with a dialog to re-accept the terms of service and reconnect to the Atlassian account. However, when I click on the "use an existing account button, I see an empty dialog box with only a "cancel" button

See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Can't connect after today's update

fields.description: Would be great to have an icon on the last commit of the build with the information like in bitbucket
fields.summary: Add Build Status like in Bitbucket

fields.description: !Screen Shot 2016-02-17 at 18.03.02.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Branches names are truncated

fields.description:
Sourcetree just updated itself on my osx 10.9 computer and now won't open.

Please don't let Sourcetree update if the operating system is incompatible.

Moreover, I cannot find an old version of Sourcetree that is osx 10.9 compatible. Please make an old version available.
fields.summary: Sourcetree updates itself to incompatible version

fields.description:
After updating to version 2.2(46) I started to have troubles with the left panel.
When I stash some code I can see the show/hide buttons, but after I delete one stash the "STASHES" is always collapsed and the show/hide button doesn't appear. It is expandable again if I create one more stash, and I cannot expand the "STASHES" if I delete one more stash again.
Also, when I reset hard to a previous commit after pressing OK on the "Warning: destructive operation" popup nothing happens. If I choose to reset mixed everything goes well.
fields.summary: problems after updating to 2.2(46)

fields.description: SourceTree crashes every time I try to merge branches, giving the ping noise in Mac OSX and becoming totally unresponsive
fields.summary: SourceTree Crashes when Merging Branches

fields.description:
Frequently, while typing a commit message, something causes portions of the left sidebar to refresh, which causes focus to move there. This means that my typing gets interrupted.

I think this may be made worse by the fact that I make extensive use of submodules, which can take a long time to refresh.
fields.summary: Focus shifts away from commit pane while typing

fields.description:
When deleting an item from Preferences > Custom Actions, the confirmation dialog pops up.
Confirming the action does nothing.

Also when the edit action panel pops up, it cannot be dismissed neither with OK or Cancel.
Quitting the app does nothing, only force quit works.
fields.summary: Cannot edit or remove a custom action

fields.description:
The focus moves to the Source list on the left when a file is staged.
When staging files, the focus moves after pressing the spacebar, clicking the checkbox or dragging the file to the staging area.
fields.summary: Focus moves away from the file list to the Source list

fields.summary: after upgrading to latest version, sourcetree will not startup / crashes / crashdump report

fields.description:
Sometimes crashes after clicking on Commit button in the bottom right corner.
Crash log attached.
fields.summary: Crash on commiting

fields.description:
Sometimes crashes on adding file to staged area using space bar.
Crash log attached.
fields.summary: Crash on adding file to staged area using space bar

fields.description:
Check in your work
Make some changes
Check them in
Make some more changes
Without checking in the second set of changes, try to do a "Hard" revert to the last checkin.
You get the "are you sure?" dialog.
Answer "yes."
Nothing.
Repeat.
Still nothing.
fields.summary: Hard Reset Never Works

fields.description:
My active branch is inside a folder based path (i.e. RR/55318). I have RR collapsed so that i don't see the list of branches, however, when I refresh content (git fetch, pull, cmd R) the collapsed folder expands to reveal the selected branch.

It should probably remember the user's setting. when in this state it should possibly also denote that the selected branch is inside the RR folder somehow (bold text when collapsed?).
fields.summary: Collapsed branch folder that contains active branch gets expanded

fields.description:
After updating to 2.2, SourceTree is asking me every time (and randomly while browsing repo) for password. I enter the password, and then it locks the UI (E.g. menu items are greyed out, even Help->Raise a support ticket). Clicking anywhere will result in hearing the error sound coming from the OS. "Solution" is to kill and restart sourcetree, until it asks you again for the password.

(Note that this also happened while installing 2.2, where it asked me to agree to the terms and conditions, and the tickbox was not clickding and only hearing an error sound. Had to kill and relaunch source tree).

I am reverting back to 2.1 until this is solved. That version was also asking me for password everytime, but at least only when pushing.
fields.summary: Keeps asking me for password randomly and then locks UI

fields.description:
Some of my branches have long names.
Yet SourceTree fails to display the whole names in the left pane.

Please see the attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Long branch names are not fully displayed in the left pane

fields.description: I have space for long names, but long names are always cutted.
fields.summary: Cuting long name of branches

fields.description:
I've just updated to the new Mac version of SourceTree.

Now on the sidebar tag and branch name are shortened (using ...) if too long, even if I enlarge the sidebar. Thus things like minibems-ws-server-0_3_24 and minibems-ws-server-0_3_25 are both displayed as minibems-ws-server-... making impossible to distinguish them.

Please switch back to the previous visualisation that was better. This new one is unusable.
fields.summary: Long (GIT) tag/branch names are shortened and unreadable

fields.description:
When checking files about to be committed focus will shift away from the file list (See attached gif). Extremely annoying when trying to check multiple files in order.

Also version 2.2 is marked as unreleased but it's the latest available through the updater.
fields.summary: Focus is shifted when checking files in commit view

fields.description: Since 2.2, the Git Flow button has disappeared from the Toolbar. This was important.
fields.summary: Git Flow Toolbar Item Gone

fields.description: When I tried to do a hard reset to a commit, it does nothing
fields.summary: Hard Reset doesn't work

fields.description: After merging two braches the id seems to be unresponsive (but for the sound). Until I force the program closing it becomes unusable. Looks like a modal dialog stays open but is not visible.
fields.summary: Ui stop working after branch merge using contextual menu on left column

fields.description:
When selecting Beyond Compare as merge tool, SourceTree returns immediately when trying to merge - Beyond Compare is never launched.

Using "Custom..." merge tool with these setitngs works:
Merge Command: /usr/local/bin/bcomp
Arguments: "$LOCAL" "$REMOTE" "$BASE" "$MERGED"

As a side note: Beyond compare as diff tool works just fine.
fields.summary: Merge using Beyond Compare does not work

fields.description:
When I merge a branch into another (e.g. develop into feature/my-feature) it freezes sourcetree and I can't interact with it anymore. 
OS X does not realise sourcetree is not responding anymore.
fields.summary: Merging Freezes Sourcetree

fields.description:
Steps to reproduces:
1. Have unstaged changes
2. Click on commit -> commit UI opens
3. stage a file (click on checkbox)
4. UI goes back to commit list UI

Expected result: UI Stays at the commit ui (with commit message textfield, staged files etc)
fields.summary: When staging files the UI switches from the commit UI to the commit list

fields.description:
Totally reproducible:
- create empty repository
- commit a file in mater
- create a new branch
- commit a file there
- merge branch into master

The application freezes, that is it does not accept any mouse/keyboard commands anymore. The menus are mostly greyed out.

As far as I can tell, the operation itself is performed.

But due the application freezing, it's not possible to work with it anymore and I need to Forge Quit it.
fields.summary: Application freezes after merging a branch

fields.description: I have downloaded and installed the newest version of Sourcetree yesterday on my MacBook Pro (Mid 2015) because a pop-up showed up suggesting to upgrade. But I have one issue: when I merge branches, it does 'the job' but when it finishes merging, Sourcetree freezes and I have to force quit it and restart the application.
fields.summary: Sourcetree freezes when merging branches

fields.description: The previous version did this.... current workaround is open .git/MERGE_MSG and copy to commit message input in Sourcetree
fields.summary: MERGE_MSG is not used as the default message

fields.description:
A user reported:

{quote}
I may have many branches (features, bug fixes, experiments) in the works.
The total number of commits needed to be pushed is irrelevant. At least, the Push button isn't the place where to display that number.

If I have a total of 10 branches (features, bug fixes, experiments), they aren't going to have the same level of readiness at the same time in order to be pushed to the remote.
Because of that, I always push only the current branch to the remote.

If there are people that push everything regardless of whether the code is ready for the eyes of the rest of the team, at least there could be an option of what the Push button should display.
{quote}
fields.summary: Give user the option for the Push button to display all branch commit counts or current branch commit counts.

fields.description:
Tool bar item for selecting filestatus, log and search view is missing from the toolbar upon upgrading to 2.2.  

 Would like to see its return
fields.summary: View selector missing from toolbar
I want to Install SourceTree. There is nothing shows in Atlasssian account page. It makes me can't finish the installation.

fields.description:
When I try to merge one branch into another, and then I click 'Cancel' - I can no longer register clicks ANYWHERE in SourceTree.

I just get the sound that indicates I'm clicking on windows that are unusable. 

I can't even exit or minimize Sourcetree by clicking, I can only use the keyboard shortcuts to look around, and I can't see a hidden window or anything. To continue to use Sourcetree, I need to Force Quit and re-launch the app. 

This makes Sourcetree 100% unusable to me, so I reverted to 2.1 and it works fine.

The attachment shows the 'merge' I'm referring to (in Sourcetree 2.1 - same thing in 2.2 though)
fields.summary: Cancelling a merge causes Sourcetree to become unusable

fields.description: When switching branches or reloading info, the commit view will snap to the last commit on that branch multiple times. It kept happening to me in the middle of a commit message, which closes the message dialog. It's a minor annoyance but I'd love for this to not happen anymore.
fields.summary: When switching branches or reloading info, commit view snaps to latest commit on that branch multiple times

fields.description:
Pull sheet on Mercurial repos becomes zombie at times.
Try a pull on a mercurial repo window. 
Some actions on it will cause the underlying window to close while the pull sheet is still there without a parent window without a way to close it.
fields.summary: Pull sheet on Mercurial repos becomes zombie at times

fields.description:
*Description*

Start Sourcetree then goto Preferences > Custom Actions > Add
Clicking {{Cancel}} does not close the dialog.
{{Ok}} is initially disabled until a menu caption is entered as expected.
After filling in a caption {{Ok}} is enabled, but clicking it does not add the action or close the dialog.

*Notes*
The logs attached are from startup, there is no log output after startup or when clicking the dialog buttons.
fields.summary: Custom Action dialog buttons unresponsive

fields.description:
Can you please support to add an account from GitLab?

Many thanks!
fields.summary: Add an account from GitLab

fields.description:
Steps to repeat:

1. Select "Create local repository" from "New Repository"
2. Select "Also create remote repository" check box
3. Select "BitBucket" from account dropdown
4. Click "Create".

Both the local and the remote repositories do get created, the but "Create Remote Dialog" never closes. I have to click "Cancel", open the repository in SourceTree and add the remote manually.

This process works perfectly with GitHub, but gets stuck when using BitBucket.
fields.summary: Create remote repository dialog doesn't close when creating BitBucket repositories

fields.description:
Confirmed in 2.2.

Go to Preferences > Custom Actions > Add > Click cancel.

the cancel button is non responsive. The user can't get out of this dialog, and you have to force quit sourcetree.
fields.summary: Unable to cancel out of custom action window.

fields.description:
After merging another branch into the current branch (by right-clicking on the branch to merge and choosing the second context option), the merge is done, but the UI remains unresponsive, as if it is waiting for the action to complete.

Many items in the menus are disabled in the same way as though an action is in progress.

It's not possible to close the workspace window or quit the app. A force quit is the only option.
fields.summary: UI becomes unresponsive after merging a branch
Can't dismiss new custom action sheet

fields.description: No matter how I resize the split between the left and right panes of the Mac version of SourceTree it doesn't relayout the text in the left pane. In the attached image you can see that my long branch names are truncated even though I've expanded the left pane to accommodate their branch names.
fields.summary: The left pane never resizes

fields.description:
On launch, SourceTree hangs at the Atlassian account authentication step. There's no option other than quitting the app. 

At this point, SourceTree is completely unusable.
fields.summary: Crash loop on authentication step in 2.2

fields.description:
In previous versions the gap between the labels was much smaller.

Now suddenly I don't see all my branches at once any more because of using up so much space.

Please narrow the space between labels. The screenshot is only an example from the Workspace, but equally applies to the branches , tags, removes, younameit.
fields.summary: Shorten gap between labels on the left side

fields.description:
Repro:
* Have any branch checked out
* Right Click any commit
* Select "Reset <branchname> to this commit
* In the Mode Dropdown choose *Hard*
* Press OK
* Warning dialog appears
* Press OK
* (x) Warning dialog disappears, but action is not carried out
fields.summary: Reset Hard does not work anymore

fields.description: It would be nice if you could double click the folder rows in the group tree to expand and collapse them rather than solely accessing it via the disclosure triangle
fields.summary: double click folders in the group tree to collapse/expand

fields.description: Request to have an option to use a flat version of the previous size of icons in the group tree and the toolbar. the lack of color is also decreasing usability.
fields.summary: allow an option to use a more compact version of the group tree icons

fields.description:
The new icons have a possibly unintended side effect.

we use branches of the form <name>/<bug_id> which organizes all our branches into per-person folders.  Unfortunately that causes an alignment issue with both the name and icons associated with those branches. They end up not being indented enough to the right so that the text is lined up properly with the enclosing "folder"'s text. This also impacts the placement of the currently selected branch icon.
fields.summary: icon alignment for the selected branch

fields.description: I currently have "uncommitted changes" selected in the commits table. Any time a git refresh occurs (periodic refresh, reset a file, discard lines, discard block, etc) the selection of the table flips back over to HEAD instead of remaining where i had it. This is definitely a regression from 2.1.
fields.summary: git refresh events and the branches tableview selection

fields.description:
I upgraded today, previously using some 2.0.x.y. version.

The icons now for ? and M are harder to differentiate.

Yes, they have obvious different colors. But still, I find them now harder to separate as for some reason they seem similar.

I guess I would prefer having unknown files just having a [?] without filled background color or something similar.
fields.summary: Icons for ? and M of newest version harder to separate

fields.description:
In SourceTree 1.x, you can use initial character on the keyboard to quickly seek to the repo, i.e., press F to seek to first repo whose name starts with 'f' (e.g. ffmpeg), but in 2.x, this functionality seems lost, it will be great if you can bring this feature back.

Thank you.
fields.summary: keyboard shortcut navigation on the favorite list

fields.description: Add checkbox "don't create backup" while reverting a file to previous versions, easy task but saves some time. instead of each time creating .org file and then manually deleting it once we don't need it
fields.summary: Add checkbox "don't create backup" while reverting a file
On Custom Actions (Preferences) you can't cancel when you try to add new action

fields.description:
First time launch of SourceTree 2.2 went well, including signing up for a new Atlasssian account via the welcome wizard.

Subsequent launches of the app never get beyond a broken welcome wizard — and when quitting the app leads to a crash.

I've ranked it as a Blocker as the bug fully prevents use of the application.
fields.summary: Subsequent launches yield a broken welcome wizard and crash on quit

fields.description:
The Git Flow actions that were available in the toolbar in previous versions of source tree are no longer there and require a menu or remembering a fairly complex key combination. 

There doesn't appear to be a way to add it to the toolbar, and I feel this (and possibly a similar one for LFS commands) would make it far easier?
fields.summary: No icon for accessing git flow actions?

fields.description: Git flow button is frequently used Toolbar button and now it's hidden deep inside menu bar. It was removed in 2.2. Please brink it back.
fields.summary: Git flow button — please bring it back

fields.description:
This request is to ask for better organization under the jump to menu.

in our project we have many tags, but they all live under a build/ or releases/ path. it would be really great if the jump to mimicked the folder structure behavior present in the branch/tags/remotes/stashes/submodules outline view, where each "folder" would be a submenu.
fields.summary: better organization of items under the jump to menu

fields.description: This request is to enable jumping to the local HEAD for a git repository via the jump to menu. It displays origin/HEAD but if you've switched to a specific commit and created a detached head you can't use that to locate the commit. This is especially troublesome when you've moved the local HEAD and the branch graph refreshes and jumps to a completely different part of the history from where the HEAD commit.
fields.summary: add local HEAD to the list of jump to locations

fields.description: since a http url is used, it is susceptible to a man in the middle attack
fields.summary: SourceTree susceptible to MITM attack by way of Sparkle.

fields.description: I'm seeing an increasingly larger number of spinning cursors and longer running spinning cursors the longer i have the app running.  Attaching a sample of one such hang to hopefully aid in debugging this issue. always available to get more logs.  I mainly see the spinning cursor when i'm doing an operation that would usually kick off a git interaction (viewing a diff, discarding a hunk, resetting a file, adding a file to a commit, committing).
fields.summary: Severe performance degradation the longer the app is running

fields.description:
Search view has this extra pane that will show you the affected files once you select a commit from the commit list.  Please update the log view to also have this pane.

See attached pics.
fields.summary: Improve log view to show commit affected file list pane

fields.description: The best one can get when commits are squashed and then the message is edited is to not use "edit message at all" and perform another Commit with "amend last commit" and then edit the message having all the features of commit message including column guide and resizing (SRCTREE-3372)
fields.summary: Missing column guide in "Edit message" textarea in interactive rebase dialog

fields.description: It's really inconvenient to compose commit messages for squashed commits
fields.summary: Allow resizing "Edit message" textarea in interactive rebase dialog

fields.description: Missing Bulk Discard Files when selecting many files "Discard", in windows version you can do it but in MAC is missing and is really annoying going one by one to discard the change.
fields.summary: Bulk Discard Files

fields.description: The message when selecting "Move" says "Movint" instead of "Moving"
fields.summary: Typo in message when moving file

fields.description:
Since my last El Capitan upgrade when I explore between local branches in SourceTree the app hangs for at least 10-20 seconds until its refreshing (the Mac activity indicator spins).
After that time it usually stops freezing and is back to normal on the new branch.
fields.summary: Moving between local branches hangs application

fields.description:
It would be nice if there was a way to show the command history but without the extra configuration parameters that are added, which would be the "friendly" view, and then you could hover or expand it to show the actual command that was run. 

So for the following command:
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree fetch origin 

The friendly version would be:
git fetch origin
fields.summary: Add option to "hide configuration parameters" in order to show "friendly" command history

fields.description:
A customer reported:

I've noticed that in a lot of places you have the word "Checkout" as a verb when it should be "Check Out". For example:

in the window toolbar (Commit, Checkout, Reset, Stash...)
in dialog buttons
Checkout Existing
Checkout New Branch
fields.summary: "Checkout" should be "Check Out"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Nothing happens after "Register Now - Free!" button is clicked when any language other than English is used.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install SourceTree for Mac 2.1
# Change the language to Japanese (could be any language other than English)
# Go to "SourceTree" -> "登録" (Register)
# Click "今すぐ登録 - 無料！" (Register Now - Free!) and find nothing happens

h3. Expected Results
Same behaviour as one when English is selected

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens
 
h3. Notes
The problem happens only in Mac. SourceTree for Windows does not have the problem.

h3.Workaround
- Select English temporarily to register
- Proceed the Method #2 in [Guide to Register for a License After 30 Days of Usage|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SOURCETREEKB/Guide+to+Register+for+a+License+After+30+Days+of+Usage] page
fields.summary: "Register Now - Free!" doesn't work if using any language other than English

fields.description:
Checking the Bypass commit hooks option shouldn't be a permanent change. The normal use case is that I want to commit a single changeset even though I know the hooks are failing, not disable the hooks entirely.

Also, you've forgot to mark 2.1 as released, since it's the version we got updated to I take it that it's released ;)
fields.summary: Bypass commit hooks should not stick

fields.description:
After attempting to merge automatically the program fails to correctly communicate to the user that a commit must be made. To an inexperienced user they will appear to be in a deadlock where if they push, they are told to pull, and if they pull they get an error.

The "nothing to commit" message is technically correct, and comes directly from GIT.  However, to an end user, they will appear to be in a deadlock where if they push, they are told to pull, and if they pull they get an error.

To improve GUI messaging around these instances, Sourcetree should:
1.If a merge commit is queued up in the File Status window it should never say "Nothing to commit". "Nothing to commit" is inaccurate and misleading. Additionally the text box at the bottom should be expanded by default to ensure that the user sees the commit that they must make.

2.If the user attempts to Pull when they still have a queued commit, after they receive the error message you should switch to the 'File Status' tab. That way the user will immediately see what they need to do to resolve this 'deadlock'
fields.summary: Improve messaging in GUI to work around "nothing to commit" GIT message after a merge.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
SourceTree doesn't show the preview / diff which is handled by Git LFS

h3. Environment
SourceTree for Mac 2.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a file with Git LFS (for example PSD file)
# Make a commit for the added file

h3. Expected Results
The preview for the added file should be shown

h3. Actual Results
The preview for files handled by Git LFS are not shown

h3.Workaround
No workaround available.
fields.summary: Show Preview/Diff of git lfs files

fields.description:
When adding a pattern to ignore a group of files (*.pyc) in the global ignore list, the files are correctly removed from the "Unstaged files" list.  However, the counter of unstaged changes on both the sidebar for the repo, as well as the global list of repos both still show a count that includes the recently ignored files.  Restarting the application resolves the issue.

To reproduce:

Right-click a file, click "Ignore"
In the resulting dialog, select "Ignore all files with this extension"
Click OK
See file vanish from Unstaged files as expected
See counter in "Working Copy" item in FILE STATUS section of sidebar remains unchanged, against my expectation
See counter in Repository Browser count of changes remains unchanged, against my expectation
fields.summary: Ignored files are still counted as pending changes in Repo list and sidebar until restart

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If one uses the command {{subst}} in Windows to associate their repo path with a drive letter, the tab of the local repository in SourceTree does not show the repo name as a title.

h3. Environment
SourceTree 1.7 -- Windows 7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy a repo, e.g. test_repo, in C:\
# In command line, execute {code}subst z: C:\test_repo{code}
# Still, in cmd, change to the new drive {code}z:{code}
# While in Z:, start SourceTree by executing this command: {code}"c:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\SourceTree.exe"{code}

h3. Expected Results
When viewing the repository in SourceTree, the tab should show the repo name.

h3. Actual Results
Instead, the repo tab's title is empty.
fields.summary: Associating a repo path with a drive letter, results in the repo tab not showing the repo name in SourceTree

fields.description:
SourceTree will freeze when a large repository is enlarged to fullscreen. It works totally fine when it is not in fullscreen.

Potentially it is because when it is changed to fullscreen, way too many processes are refreshed and being rerun, causing the freeze.
fields.summary: SourceTree freezes when a large repository is enlarged to fullscreen.

fields.description: It would be very useful to see the parent module's name when a submodule is open, because I may have that submodule in many other projects too and currently it's hard to find out which window represents which instance.
fields.summary: Show the name of the parent module in window title when I open a submodule

fields.description: When applying a stash, the default value for "Delete after applying" checkbox is checked, it would be great to have the ability to change the default value and make it unchecked.
fields.summary: Ability to change "Delete after applying" default value when applying Stash

fields.description:
# Clone a repo
# Click to open activity progress view.

You're able to see action progress in the main view, with the small bar, but the main activity progress view doesn't reflect the real progress state designed in the main window (repository browser).

Moreover you're unable to close the action progress view (due to missing close button!). You can only maximize or minimize the window.

See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Repository action progress view
